ir.taghizadeh.tehran.dependencies.geoFire

Class GeoFireImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • ir.taghizadeh.tehran.dependencies.geoFire.GeoFireImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GeoFire

    public class GeoFireImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements GeoFire

    GeoFireImpl

    The main logic about GeoFire is done here and we can have access to these methods with GeoFire interface which is injected into GeoFireModuleActivity.

    Since:
    2019-01-07
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ali Taghizadeh Gevari

    • Method Detail

      • pushLocation

        public void pushLocation(java.lang.String dbLocation,
                         java.lang.String key,
                         com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng latLng)
        It pushes LatLng up into Firebase database and when it's done it passes the key of that node to our listener.
        Specified by:
        pushLocation in interface GeoFire
        Parameters:
        dbLocation - This is the name of the node in database where we want to push data.
        key - This is the key to the right object to finally push that LatLng.
        latLng - This is the LatLng of a particular place that we want to push.

      • queryLocations

        public void queryLocations(java.lang.String dbLocation,
                           com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng latLng,
                           double distance)
        First it executes a query at the location that it gets. Then it waits for data to get ready and when it's done, it passes the content of the received snapshot as a LinkedHashMap of keys and GeoLocations to our listener.
        Specified by:
        queryLocations in interface GeoFire
        Parameters:
        dbLocation - This is the name of the node in database where we want to execute a query
        latLng - This is a certain LatLng that we want to find nearest locations around it.
        distance - This indicates the radius around our LatLng where we want to search for locations.
